Polygonum minus, also known as kesum, is an aromatic plant in the Polygonaceae family, which primarily grows in temperate regions. The plant originates from Southeast Asian countries such as Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, and Indonesia, where it is widely used as a spice and flavouring agent in the food industry. P. minus is abundant in Malaysia, where it has recently been listed in the National Agro-Food Policy by the Malaysian government to promote its production as a way to boost the agricultural economy.
